subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to comment test methods in Junit 4?
msgSnippet: ... Right, but one Filter class can only filter one Test class since it s tied to a Request class: Request request= Request.aClass(Example.class); I was just
messageBody:
On 6/6/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Cedric,
>
> I don't understand your message. Subclasses of Filter can be defined
> anywhere.


Right, but one Filter class can only filter one Test class since it's tied
to a Request class:

Request request= Request.aClass(Example.class);

I was just pointing out that in my experience, filters that apply to the
entire test suite are more flexible and usually more useful than filters
that apply to one test class only.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
